title: Drupal Phar File Parsing Deserialization of Untrusted Data Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on vulnerable installations of Drupal. Authentication is required to exploit this vulnerability.
The specific flaw exists within the handling of Phar archives. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, which can result in deserialization of untrusted data. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of the web server.
addtionnal_details: Drupal has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:https://www.drupal.org/sa-core-2019-002
timeline:
2018-09-10 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2019-01-25 - Coordinated public release of advisory
